Instrument.name: 2001 Mars Odyssey Spacecraft Mars Radiation Environment Experiment
Instrument.description: The 2001 Mars Odyssey Spacecraft Mars Radiation Environment Experiment (MARIE) was designed to measure the radiation environment on Mars. Its primary objective was to assess the radiation levels that future astronauts might be exposed to on the Martian surface. MARIE measured the flux of cosmic rays and solar energetic particles (SEPs) near Mars, providing valuable data on the planet's radiation environment and its potential impact on human exploration. This instrument also contributed to understanding the role of Mars' thin atmosphere and lack of a global magnetic field in shielding the surface from harmful radiation.
